page.title: 03East Worldham
page.content: {East Worldham}is an old village near{Alton. }The{church}was built in 1204. {Sandals cottages}were built as a farmhouse in 1312: No.1 used to be a baking barn, No.2 used to be the farmhouse, No.3 used to be the dairy. The stone which is at the top of the hill is a landmark called the {pudding stone}where{King John}and his men got on and off their horses. In the{church}the{font}is{Victorian. Behind the{altar}is{the ten {commandments}which were put in the church 1234. Where the pub is there used to be a{milestone,}but it got knocked down. The pub was built in 1799. Park Farm was built in 1920.
